page.title: 13MOBILE SERVICES
page.content:
As in many rural areas there is a {travelling library}service. It calls in the area every other Wednesday and has done so for the past 15 years. Painscastle has around 15 borrowers and Rhosgoch has 8. Lack of time to change the stock, the limited amount of space in the van and lack of time to ask people what kind of books they would like the library to stock are the main problems of the librarians.
The{post bus}was started in 1984. Very few people use it because it is a slow method of transport and they have access to a car. Nevertheless it started because there was a need for this kind of service locally and the drivers are convinced of its value. It gets rather full at Erwood and Aberedw with peoples shopping and push chairs.
